title: Martin Winter
text:
Martin Winter, PhD
I am Dirichlet fellow at TU Berlin. My main mathematical interest is Geometry in all of its forms, most actively, discrete, algebraic, convex and computational geometry, also touching on many aspects of graph theory, topology and representation theory.
I am principal investigator in the priority program “Combinatorial Synergies”. My project “Wachspress Coordinates - a Bridge betwen Algebra, Geometry and Combinatorics” will be conducted at the Max-Planck-Institute for Mathematics in the Sciences in Leipzig (Germany), starting April 2025.
martin.h.winter@warwick.ac.uk






Research interests
I work(ed) and published on

polyhedral combinatorics and geometry,
graph theory (spectral, algebraic, geometric and topological),
rigidity theory, geometric constraint system and real algebraic geometry,
low-dimensional topology (knot theory, embeddings and embeddability of graphs and complexes, …)
symmetries of discrete and geometric objects,
finite group theory and real representation theory,
algebraic combinatorics (association schemes, distance regular graphs, codes …),
convex geometry,
random structures and graph limits,
discrete dynamical systems, …
